```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(survival)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(survminer)
library(gtsummary)
library(kableExtra)
library(gridExtra)
```

## discription in two treatment

```{r}
head(rotterdam)
Rotterdam=data.frame(rotterdam)
colSums(is.na(Rotterdam))
stats <- Rotterdam %>% 
  mutate(
    treat = case_when(
      hormon == 0 ~ "Treat = 0",
      hormon == 1 ~ "Treat = 1"))%>% 
  select(-pid, -hormon, -rtime, -recur, -dtime, -death)
stats <- stats %>% 
  bind_rows(stats %>% 
              mutate(treat = "Overall"))
stats %>%
  tbl_summary(by = treat) %>% 
   modify_caption("**People Characteristics for Hormon Treatment**") %>%
  bold_labels()
```

## KM estimation

```{r}
status  <- pmax(rotterdam$recur, rotterdam$death)
rfstime <- with(rotterdam, ifelse(recur==1, rtime, dtime))

surv_obj <- Surv(time = rfstime, event = status)

km_fit1 <- survfit(surv_obj ~ 1)
ggsurvplot(km_fit1, data=  rotterdam,                  
           pval = TRUE,                
           conf.int = TRUE,           
           risk.table = TRUE,          
           ggtheme = theme_minimal(),  
           palette = "Dark2",         
           main = "Kaplan-Meier Survival Curve", 
           xlab = "Time",              
           ylab = "Survival Probability") 
```


```{r}
km_fit2 <- survfit(surv_obj ~ Rotterdam$hormon)


ggsurvplot(km_fit2, data=  rotterdam,                  
           pval = TRUE,                
           conf.int = TRUE,           
           risk.table = TRUE,          
           ggtheme = theme_minimal(),  
           palette = "Dark2",         
           main = "Kaplan-Meier Survival Curve", 
           xlab = "Time",              
           ylab = "Survival Probability") 
```

The total number of subjects observed was 1546, among which 1080 experienced the event of interest
We can see from the Chisq and p-values here suggest that the non-linear relationships of these variables are significant. 


```{r}
Rotterdam$censored_status <- ifelse(status == 1, 0, 1)  # Assuming '1' in status indicates the event
surv_fit <- survfit(Surv(rfstime, status) ~ censored_status, data = Rotterdam)
ggsurvplot(
  surv_fit, 
  data = Rotterdam,
  pval = TRUE,                   # 显示 P 值
  risk.table = TRUE,             # 显示风险表
  linetype = "strata",           # 不同分层使用不同的线型
  ggtheme = theme_minimal(),     # 使用简洁主题
  palette = c("#00BA38", "#F8766D"), # 定制颜色
  legend.title = "Status",
  legend.labs = c("Uncensored", "Censored"),
  xlab = "Time",
  ylab = "Survival Probability"
)
```
